EnableLUA.description: Controls User Account Control (UAC). When 0, UAC prompts are disabled (not recommended); when 1, UAC is enabled.

ConsentPromptBehaviorAdmin.description: Controls the behavior of UAC prompts for administrators.

values.1: Prompt for credentials on the secure desktop
values.2: Prompt for consent on the secure desktop

*.description: Programs listed here are configured to run automatically when Windows starts (system-wide). Value name = friendly name, value data = command or path.
Programs listed here run automatically at user logon (per-user). Value name = friendly name, value data = command or path.

Wallpaper.description: Path to the current desktop wallpaper image file.

ScreenSaveActive.description: Indicates whether the screen saver is active for the current user.

*.description: Each subkey represents a system service or driver. Important values include 'Start' (when the service starts) and 'ImagePath' (binary path).

values.Start: Service start type (0: Boot, 1: System, 2: Automatic, 3: Manual, 4: Disabled)
values.ImagePath: Path to service executable or driver

EnableDeadGWDetect.description: Determines whether Windows will detect and switch to alternate default gateways when the current gateway is unreachable.

Hostname.description: Computer network name (hostname) used for certain network operations.

WaitToKillServiceTimeout.description: Time in milliseconds Windows waits for services to stop before forcing termination during shutdown/restart.

NoAutoUpdate.description: When set, disables automatic Windows Updates according to policy. (Managed by Group Policy in many environments.)
